p: The process of obtaining the essential oil (EO) was carried out at the Laboratory of Pharmacognosy and Phytochemistry of the Federal University of Amapá (UNIFAP), where the leaves of the plant species were dehydrated in a greenhouse with air circulation at 36°C. The EO was extracted by hydrodistillation in a Clevenger-type apparatus at 100°C for two hours [ 8]; it was stored in an amber bottle and cooled to −20°C in the dark.
